document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Wasmann, E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Wasmann, E. (1925 b) Die Ameisenmimikry, ein exakter Beitrag zum Mimikryproblem und zur Theorie der Anpassung. (250. Beitrag zur Kenntnis der Myrmecophilen). Abhandlungen zur Theoretischen Biologie, 19, xii + 1 - 164, pls. 1 - 3.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.
24 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Belize , Honduras , El Salvador , Nicaragua , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Guyana , Ecuador , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Paraguay , Argentina .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Lathrobium whitei Abdullah & Abdullah, 1968
43 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Key: Lynch-Arribálzaga 1884: 237 (species of Buenos Aires province , Argentina ); Blackwelder 1939: 98 (subgenera); Blackwelder 1943: 308 (species of the West Indies).
West Indies: Cuba , Jamaica , Dominican Republic , Puerto Rico , Trinidad-Tobago.
South America: Brazil , Paraguay , Uruguay , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Lathrobium apicale Baudi di Selve, 1857

bibRefCitation.author: Korge, H.
bibRefCitation.refString: Korge, H. (1971) Beitrage zur Kenntnis der Koleopterenfauna Kleinasiens. Annotationes Zoologicae et Botanicae, 67, 1 - 68. Kraatz, G. (1856 a) Eine neue Gattung aus der Familie der Staphylinen. Verhandlungen des Zoologisch-Botanischen Vereins in Wien, 6, 625 - 626, pl. 7.

subSubSection.paragraph: 9 species are included in this genus from West and South America.
Characters/Description: Blackwelder 1939: 98 (characters in key); Blackwelder 1943: 230 (characters in key), 311 (characters).
Key: Blackwelder 1939: 98 (subgenera); Blackwelder 1943: 312 (species of the West Indies); Assing 2012d: 51 (characters).
West Indies: Cuba , Cayman Is., Haiti , Dominican Republic , US Virgin Isl.
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian.

subSubSection.paragraph: 3 species are included in this genus from South America.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to Central America.

subSubSection.paragraph: 5 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Characters/Description: Coiffait & Sáiz 1968: 380 (characters in key), 390 (characters); Assing 2012d: 51 (characters).
West Indies: Cuba , Haiti , Dominican Republic , US Virgin Isl., St. Lucia .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Bolivia , Brazil , Paraguay , Uruguay , Chile , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian.
5 species are known from and are restricted to South America.
Key: Herman 1979: 4 (species of the genus); Matějíček 2018: 68 (species of the genus).
South America: Venezuela , Brazil , Paraguay , Uruguay , Argentina .

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is included in this genus from West Indies.
